meanings.definition: Agreement or harmony between people or groups.
meanings.sent1: In our neighborhood, there is always concord among the residents.
meanings.sent2: The concord between the two friends was evident in their shared laughter.
meanings.sent3: At the family reunion, there was so much concord that even the pets got along.
meanings.sent4: The concord in the classroom was like a symphony of cooperation.
meanings.sent5: The concord in the choir's voices created a beautiful harmony.

meanings.sent1: The concord between the two nations prevented war.
meanings.sent2: The concord signed by the leaders brought peace to the region.
meanings.sent3: The concord between the siblings stated they would share the toys.
meanings.sent4: The concord among the business partners ensured fair trade.
meanings.sent5: The concord between the companies led to a successful merger.

meanings.sent1: The concord of the instruments filled the concert hall.
meanings.sent2: The concord of the birds chirping in the morning was soothing.
meanings.sent3: The concord of the wind chimes created a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The concord of the waves crashing on the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The concord of the church bells echoed through the valley.
